definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The ripest peach is highest on the tree.
sentences.chinese: 最成熟的桃子在最高的枝条。

sentences.english: The virus came to the tulip from a louse living on peaches and potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 这些病毒来自于桃子和土豆上的一种寄生虫。

sentences.english: But peaches can not defeat Tai Long.
I went to my student 's orchard to pick peaches and pears .
sentences.chinese: 我到学生的果园去摘桃子和梨。

sentences.english: They are made of wheat flour and they look just like real peaches.
sentences.chinese: 它们是用麦粉做的，不过看起来就跟真的桃子一样。

sentences.english: If you eat peaches grown on those trees, you will never die.
sentences.chinese: 如果你吃了那些桃树上结出的桃子，你就能长生不死。

sentences.english: Pack the peaches carefully so that they won't get bruised.
sentences.chinese: 小心包装桃子，别让它们碰伤或压伤。
他的捏拧擦伤了桃子的表面。

sentences.english: B: It looks best in spring, when the plum and cherry blossoms are out.
sentences.chinese: 温带核果植物像樱桃，桃子和李子也有受冻的危险。

sentences.english: It exquisitely matches filled peaches, soft macaroons , fruits tart and pastries.
sentences.chinese: 与桃子，杏仁饼干，水果蛋糕等搭配为佳。

sentences.english: This wine is bold and rich, featuring mouth-filling flavours of peachy fruit sweetness, intermingling with toasty vanillin oak.
sentences.chinese: 大胆，丰富，甜甜的桃子带着香草橡木味充满了味蕾。

sentences.english: The baker makes both peach and pumpkin pies.
sentences.chinese: 面包师做桃子和南瓜派。

sentences.english: We bought a basket of peaches.
We bought a basketful of peaches.
sentences.chinese: 我们买了满满一篮子桃子。

definition: litchi or lychee fruit (Litchi chinensis Sonn.)
